website_summaries.verdict: Because not every bed sits next to the wall, this double-sided bedrail protects both edges.
pros: For use with mattress and box spring
Patented Gap Guard prevents gaps between rail and mattress
cons: Some users say this product is less than 20 inches tall, so use caution with thicker mattresses

customer_reviews.title: Two people makes for faster installation
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased a single bed rail for my older son a few years ago and liked the quality, so I purchased two of these double bed rails because my twins were transitioning into twin beds. They were easy enough to put together, but the tricky part was getting them on the box spring and then adding the mattress...which I struggled with by myself. But once I got it figured out for the first bed, the second one was operational in minutes. My 2 1/2 year olds are rough on things, but these are very durable, and strong as well. We often put them in the same bed to sleep because they sleep better and the rails have never failed
customer_reviews.author: DGgirl06

customer_reviews.title: Great bedrail for co-sleeping
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because our baby was co-sleeping and we wanted her to be able to sleep in our bed without us. We set up the top end very close to the head of the bed and usually place a rolled up matat the end of the bed so she can't roll off the foot of the bed (when we are not with her). I'm so glad that we purchased these. They are safe, sturdy, and work well.
customer_reviews.author: jem

customer_reviews.title: We finally sleep again.
customer_reviews.text: This rail is taller and longer than most bedrails. Our daughter stopped sleeping in her crib at 14 months. We ordered this for a full-size bed, and she has been safely sleeping in it. She now naps and sleeps at night in her own bed and in her own room. I wouldn't say we are a well-rested family, but we are on our way!
customer_reviews.author: Parents with kids

customer_reviews.title: Product is not 20 inches High.
customer_reviews.text: Package says it will fit Queen Bed with Larger mattresses, not correct. It fits but the rail is not tall enough on larger mattresses Package says rail is 20" High, that is incorrect also, they are only 18" High. I returned this item because it was not tall enough to stop the child from falling out of our Queen bed with the taller mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Makin

customer_reviews.title: Great for transitioning to "big bed"
customer_reviews.text: We have the single-sided version of this bed rail as well, and this functions exactly the same, but on both sides of the bed. Our two year old moved to a twin bed pretty young in order to use the crib for her baby brother and this has been a life-saver. She always liked to sleep up against the side of her crib, so we expected she would do the same in a twin bed. The rails are very long, covering about 2/3 of the length of the bed, making it feel secure. Our daughter sleeps up against the bed rails and I don't have any concerns about her falling out. Great for transitioning a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: MommyM

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I must say I'm impressed. Very much so. First off it was insanely easy to put together. Literally no more than 10 minutes. Its study, and its perfect. Our 8 month old son sleeps with us and has since his arrival at home. He Would not fall asleep unless it's in our bed, which is a queen btw, so that is the reason I bought these bed rails. The only little minor thing is the mesh is of some flimsy material, so it can be ripped easily, but they sell replacements for it, so no biggie! All in all, I love it and I'm so glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: I am a female and I assembled with my almost 3 year old right by my side. The directions aren’t super super clear, but I’m also not great at these things. I make it my husband’s job, but I figured it out! They are super sturdy. I have read others say their kids have fallen out, I truly don’t know how that would occur unless it’s installed improperly. I have ours adjusted tight and I don’t feel it’s going anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter started rolling and fell out of bed one night so I knew I needed rails for her bed. These were SUPER easy to assemble and put together. Took about 15 minutes by myself. It’s was very straightforward, didn’t even really need the instructions. I just glanced at them and then did my own thing. Note: when attaching the rails to the bottom frame part, make sure the holes match up because one side has this knobby thing and will only go in one way. I got one backwards, which caused some confusion on my end, but once I figured that out I was fine.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Difficult assembly & Poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard to assemble with very poor instructions, my husband & I have assembled many things with relative ease. We know how to read & follow directions. These instructions were pretty much useless. We figured out how to assemble the bed rail by looking closely at the picture on the box! The product pieces are not labeled, the instructions are not specific & the illustrations are too small to actually be helpful. We have it put together & it is on the bed, It seems sturdy so we are hopeful, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: eileennik

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for my son! Now he can start sleeping in his big boy bed. He's an active sleeper adlnd this helps prevent him from rolling off the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Peachy1023

customer_reviews.title: It works, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a platform style bed with a bookshelf headboard and we had a hard time fitting the bulky bottom pieces between the wood and the mattress. Once we fit them, we wrapped hand towels around them to make sure they didn’t scratch the wood. The rails serve their purpose and I feel like my daughter is safe, but they do not let down and release like they are meant to because of how they are forced between the bed and the mattress. It would’ve been nice if there was a long flat bar to hold the rails in place under the mattress instead of the bulky plastic pieces used.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley P.

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: we got this for our sons top bunk bed. it is not a platform underneath the mattress, in fact it’s a metal slatted bunky board and this railing works fine with it. easy to tighten, the rails are not flimsy at all once they’re tightened. they’re very tall so my son feels very safe in his top bunk. they’re extremely simple to fold down and changing sheets hasn’t been a problem for me
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Perryman

customer_reviews.title: Not for toddler bed
customer_reviews.text: This item is rather bulky to use on a toddler bed however we were able to make it work without using the extensions that connect to the bottom of the mattress. My son sleeps wild and needed protection along the entire side of his toddler bed. The instructions for this product were also misleading and a tad but confusing. Overall worth the money if you are using for a twin size or larger bed.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but not super easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a pain in the rear to put together. You need two people to assemble it, especially for a full size bed. The rails lock and unlock easily. My daughter's bed cannot be pushed against the wall due to the heat vent, so this was perfect to keep her from falling out of bed. The mesh is breathable. The fabric party easily comes off to wash it if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, good for thick mattress
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 yr old grandson is a tosser and turner while he sleeps. This puts our mind at ease while he sleeps. Easy to install, does help to have another person though. One to hold up the mattress while other lays out straps. It's easy to fold down the rails when not needed. Although the rail is about an inch longer than the top of our box spring and bed frame to the floor. So when it's down it sits at a slight angle.We have a plush top mattress, 10 inches thick and the rail is about 8 +/- inches high from top of mattress. Straps easily adjust to width of bed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: This bedrail was agonizing to put together. The instructions were worthless. Once my husband and I got the railing together, we found it would not be safe for our young granddaughter. The bedspread would not be able to be used and when we put the railings down they did not stay up against the bed's side of the mattress. Thankfully it did not take as much time to disassemble We returned it. Don't waist your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: NANCY NESBITT

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Toddler from Rolling
customer_reviews.text: My daughter moves often in her sleep and after she fell out of her bed in the middle of the night, we bought her these. They work great. They feel sturdy and they weren't so difficult to install. I only had some troubles because I accidentally got the straps twisted as they were put on the rails, which makes it difficult to tighten, so I had to start over again. After I got the rails installed correctly, I was pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bed rails
customer_reviews.text: So these bed rails work great and are very sturdy. My 2 year old actually climbs over them to get into bed. The only reason i didn't give this 5 starts is because for his bed I cannot use the drop down feature because of how his bed sits in the bed frame. We have the camp bunk beds from pottery barn and the mattress sits just below the bed rail so we cannot drop it down. I decided to go with the 2 sides even though his bed is up against the wall i didn't want him rolling into the wall or getting a foot stuck. its worked out really well.
customer_reviews.author: andiabm

customer_reviews.title: Folds down easily
customer_reviews.text: When we converted my child's bed to a toddler bed, we only needed one rail and we purchased another product. We found this rail to be very difficult to fold down, and actually had quite a bit of difficulty getting it down during a medical emergency. My mom had purchased the Regalo rails for her home and I loved the ease of the rails folding down, I bought my own when we changed to a full size bed. The ease of folding down the rail was the selling point for me!
customer_reviews.author: GolfersDS

customer_reviews.title: Buy these.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of this product. We bought the double rails for our daughter about 3 years ago. This purchase was for our son. Both our children are wild sleepers. Without these rails, they would fall out of bed for sure. The one for our daughter is still in good shape. Our kids are toddlers, but hold my weight 160lbs, when I have to lay with them to get them alseep.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Garcia

customer_reviews.title: 1 Less Thing to Worry About ...
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced product, relatively easy to assemble and does the job of keeping my 3 yo from falling out of her new big girl bed with slats. My little one is a rough sleeper, she’s tosses and turns, sleeps sideways, diagonally you name it she sleeps that way. These rails hold up and protect her from falling out! Wish there were more colors!
customer_reviews.author: D35TR00

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bed rails
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my sons first big boy bed, queen size bed, to go along the side of it to so he wouldn't fall out. The directions that come with the bed rails are kind of confusing but with a little common sense, I was able to assemble these within 30 minutes. I would definitely recommend having 2 people when trying to put them on the bed due to lifting the mattress up and over the leg holders so they don't move on you. Otherwise, they are very sturdy and do exactly what they are intended for. They are nice size too!
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: Fits any size bed and hold up very well
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my son’s twin bed. They were easy to install and easy to use. As he has grown, and moved to a very high sitting, four poster, king bed, we are still using these. They truly fit all size beds. I will buy another set when my daughter moves out of her crib into a real bed.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart C.

customer_reviews.title: Great double rails
customer_reviews.text: Great product! We had to move our kids bed away from the walls, and was worried about our toddlers falling off the bed. Most Rails only secure one side, but we need both. So this worked really great and we don't have to worry about our toddlers falling out in the middle of the night
customer_reviews.author: RosannaÃÂ hardin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bed rails
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy bed rails. Once installed under the mattress, they will stay in place. The weight of the mattress (if it sits flat on the frame or box) should hold the rail frame in. May require 2 people to set up (as you may need to lift up the mattress to slide & pull the rail assembly). Quick latch to open & close (on both ends).
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be lowered all the way down.
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped to swing the side down to get it out of the way on one side of the bed. It hits the floor. An my bed is on risers! The result is that I stowed the bedrail under the mattress on one side. However, the problem exists on the deployed side as well. The only way out of the bed is to scoot down to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Flamingo Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Nice too have
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a grandaughter that stays with us often. She is only a year old but it is nice to lay her down for a nap and not constantly worry about her rolling off the bed. It is something that will work even better as she gets older and starts sleeping by herself. It is well constructed and was easy to install on our queen size bed in the extra room. I installed it by myself and did not have to remove the matress. Highly recommend especially for the price. It was the best deal i found and arrived quickly
customer_reviews.author: eric rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Builders grade bed rails
customer_reviews.text: I had a trouble time even receiving the product. The bars are dented and bent. We were so frustrated with the whole process. But, instead of returning it my husband bent the bars enough to lock in each other. Overall it’s okay, but i think it’s lower grade.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Lord have mercy
customer_reviews.text: Just do yourself a favor, pour yourself a glass of wine before you start building After praying, taking it apart twice, and fighting with my husband. I finally got this master piece together. It works good. IF you can build it
customer_reviews.author: ashley dull

customer_reviews.title: Straps Did Not Connect Under Mattress
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cousin who had to move in with my mother during the pandemic. It was for a bed for her baby because there is no space for her crib. The only way she has been able to use the bed rails is by pushing a table up against them. She says there is no way to attach the straps under the mattress. Maybe the instructions are unclear or there is a missing part??? Either way this is not a safe solution. I will be calling the company on her behalf and I hope they can give her the support she needs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bachler

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived on time and was so easy to assemble. I got the double rail to prevent my granddaughter from slipping off either side of her bed at my house. The safety feature of connecting the two rails under the mattress were helpful as well.
customer_reviews.author: EJMB

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 4yrs ago for my son. Still holding on steady like I just purchased it. Since it has proven itself as a great product I made another purchase 4yrs later for my daughter. High enough and study enough to give me piece of mind that my kids wouldn’t fall off their bed while they are sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: fizzle

customer_reviews.title: Ripped.
customer_reviews.text: Returned the day after it delivered. Seemed ripped before i could hook it together.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley B

customer_reviews.title: Love these bed rails!!
customer_reviews.text: This product works wonderful! I put the side down to lay with my daughter every night easy down and back up in the dark. Very sturdy and doesn’t bend or wobble if my daughter lays against them. Gives me great piece of mind being that there are tile floors in the rooms.I totally recommend this item!!
customer_reviews.author: Kriste c

customer_reviews.title: Great bedrails
customer_reviews.text: These bedrails worked great for my 20 month old grandson when we were on vacation. The first time I assembled they were a little tricky, but each time after it was very easy. I would definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Lv2read

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for toddlers learning how to sleep in big boy ...
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for toddlers learning how to sleep in big boy beds... they don't fall to the sides super safe, i'm that over protective mom so I tried them out by pushing on the because my child is a wild child but definitely help up, they're long, I have them on a twin size bed and it basically over half of the bad frame. they're perfect definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: Cosleeping family here, and these rails work great on our king bed. I was worried because we have a deep mattress, but these are plenty high enough! I installed these by myself in about 20 minutes while my husband was at work.
customer_reviews.author: Katelann

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this product!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed by the quality and price of this. It attached perfectly to the bed I needed to and allows to be taken down easy. I was able to put this together on my own with no help and I didn't even have to use the instructions. It's great and very lengthy so it'll provide the coverage you need for keeping a kid safe at night. For those wondering like I was before buying - it does come with both rails!
customer_reviews.author: Michele F

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly once you fill in the instruction gaps
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought these, but I about lost my mind trying to fill in the gaps with the instructions. There are illustrations, but some critical information was left out - mainly at the point where you are attaching the piece with the straps that will help tighten the rails underneath the mattress. Also, this is a lot easier with two people rather than just one. I think the product will be great, but the instructions need some definite fine tuning.
customer_reviews.author: Malyssah

customer_reviews.title: not as expected
customer_reviews.text: it does not work as I expected. I think the rail guard only works well with a mattress sitting on a flat box. our mattress sits a little inside the bed frame and it does not work that well. it just gets stuck between the mattress and frame and we could not open it. Make sure to confirm whether your mattress is sitting on a flat box before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for our bed
customer_reviews.text: We have a platform style bed. The rails didn't fit as they ends jutted out to much and hit the frame. Product needs more pictures. It looks like they would work just not with the bed we have.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Yu

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. But the item came ripped but still assembled either way, after a couple days it was completely ripped off and we didn’t really mess with it either.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Might need 2 people to help set up
customer_reviews.text: Giving this product a 5 star because it was just what I expected when I received the package. I used it with a queen size mattress and it worked just fine. I feel like the straps were long enough to fit under a king size. The railings are pretty sturdy long, which prevents my 2-year-old from falling.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble! Our mattress took up 10 inches but still effectively replaced the need for stacking pillows around the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Elletserod

customer_reviews.title: described as easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: if you have four people handy to assemble and set up this product that would be my suggestion. the siderails of my youth were made of sturdy materials, this is not. the application and set up of the old timey ones consisted of siderails fabricated in one piece and four long supports that easily slid under the mattress holding the rails in place. This design is three steps forward five steps backwards. Would not recommend,
customer_reviews.author: christopher k.

customer_reviews.title: It didn't assemble in seconds, but once it's together it's sturdy and works like it should.
customer_reviews.text: My son leans against it all day and night and it doesn't budge. My child's safety is dependent on this rail working like it says it does, and it lives up to it.
customer_reviews.author: CHRiSTOPHER

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I love that the two side are attached to each other so you can pull them tight to the bed. Definitely strong enough to hold your child in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't collapse fully out of the way
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine, but wish it had a height adjustment. When side rails down, they hit the floor about 4" from vertical. Have to remove rails to make the bed, else you're leaning over to reach the bed
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: ... minutes- did NOT attach the 2 bed rails together like it suggested - had 2 beds that needed bed ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't read the directions but was able to put together in less than 5 minutes- did NOT attach the 2 bed rails together like it suggested - had 2 beds that needed bed rails and it worked!
customer_reviews.author: E. Kulling

customer_reviews.title: Just meh.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sturdy once installed correctly, but the clips/latches loosen up if your kid rocks the rail back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: EngineerOpinion

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Functions great. I do t really ever need to put them down so they aleays stay up. But definitely works great.
customer_reviews.author: GMJ124

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: We are so disappointed in both the product and customer service. We were unable to assemble one of the rails due to missing components. I will say the assembly for the other rail was simple. When we reached out to Regalo, as instructed, they offered ZERO help. Now my son will have to wait even longer to use his “big boy bed” as we will search for a better product. A real shame.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Natale Kannel

customer_reviews.title: Not great for metal slated bed
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a really good, quality product, but it didn't work for the bed we purchased for our toddler. We have a metal slated bed with no box spring. While we could have made it work, the rails pulled at the mattress and made it uneven. I think it's a great railing for a bed with a box spring. However, for a slated bed, a foam bumper has worked to keep our 2.5 year old from falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The straps don't help the rails in being sturdy. They are flimsy rails and aren't cushioned so ...
customer_reviews.text: The picture should have showed that there were straps underneath the mattress that connect both rails. The straps don't help the rails in being sturdy. They are flimsy rails and aren't cushioned so you can feel the metal frame of the rails!!!! Horrible! Money in the trash :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Requires 2 hands to secure
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased another bed railing before where it would be secured on its own just by lifting the railing. With this one, I was disappointed that you have to make sure the latches are in the right spot, on both sides, requiring both hands to hold, before securing the latches. Sometimes hard to do after the little one goes to bed and it's dark in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy1230

customer_reviews.title: Worked!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a friend visiting, who had 2 small children. It worked, but it was a little bit of work setting it up and just FYI - does not come up very high on pillow-top mattresses.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t come with instructions.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bed hoping it’d keep my baby from rolling off. It’s not quite high enough for my bed, but thats not the manufacturer’s fault it’s made for a toddler bed. The only problem I had is it didn't come with instructions and I had to look them up online. I still couldn’t figure out how to secure it in place under the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Greg & Mindy Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to assemble correctly
customer_reviews.text: We just unboxed to assemble for a visiting grandchild. Three of us couldn’t get one part to assemble. We consider ourselves to be intelligent enough to read and follow directions, but we never did get one part to fit properly. We finally put it back in the box... our return window is closed or I would send it back. This was the first time we needed to use it so we had not tried it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: We needed something for our son who is 17 months, sleeping on a queen mattress. He likes to toss and turn in the middle of the night so we needed something that would keep him safe. Love this product as it does its purpose. Very sturdy. Took a little thinking to put it together but not difficult by any means. Fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ri

customer_reviews.title: Another satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned about the quality of these rails because they were very inexpensive, but they are actually made really well! I love how they hook together and they are very user friendly. They fit our 2 year old's double bed very well and I love that I can easily fold the rails down to make the bed. I would definitely recommend this product to others!
customer_reviews.author: Daron and Stephanie L

customer_reviews.title: Good, standard side rails
customer_reviews.text: These are very standard and sturdy side rails. They can be annoying to put back in the up position if you get a little piece of sheet or comforter in the way, and I've pinched my fingers a few times. However, my son has not fallen out of bed, which is their major function.
customer_reviews.author: Menke

customer_reviews.title: Defective packaging
customer_reviews.text: The item is defective. I had to have it and it is doable but I had to duct tape one of the side rails together because I didn’t get the correct pieces. The side rails click together. Well one side is right, the other side has two of the same piece so would not click together.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great once we got it but together. It was a pain in the butt to assemble and install on a full size bet
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Fries

customer_reviews.title: The rails are able to be lowered which is also a great feature because then I can lay in bed with ...
customer_reviews.text: The two rails are connected by 2 adjustable straps that go under the mattress. The rails are able to be lowered which is also a great feature because then I can lay in bed with my child should they need me. No complaints thus far!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: In reading the reviews, I took a chance and got what I was hoping for. Suits my needs.

customer_reviews.title: Bed guards
customer_reviews.text: Came with 2, which I didnt realize. Great surprise. Very sturdy!

customer_reviews.title: A Little Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed in this product. It was a little flimsier than expected. It is kind of hard to put together & tighten by yourself. Its really lightweight and has held up decent. We did have some issues with the clasp that tightens down popped off, but we were able to pop it back in.

customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my daughter. They serve their purpose and we're easy to put on but one of the locking mechanisms is a little funny. It still locks just fine but when the rails are down the locks are supposed to stay in the upright position. one of the 4 always falls down so I have to lift it up before I put that side up. Other than that no complaints!

customer_reviews.title: If you want to lose hours of your life then buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this bed rail!!! The directions were terrible noting lettered notes in the instructions yet none of the product was labeled as such and no image would help you decide which one was which letter.

customer_reviews.text: Effective, used for my mother and now used for grandchildren.

customer_reviews.title: Not for every type of bed
customer_reviews.text: Generally the quality of the product is good, but it has big design issue. If the frame of the bed is not flush with the base (base is deeper), then this will not fit inside the frame, and putting the plastic parts out of frame makes it too bad for several reasons; 1st, both sides stick out, so bed becomes wider without any use, 2nd, the metal bars still go deeper to reach the base, which means the whole rail gets inclined toward the middle of the bed, instead of being vertical, and finally, 3rd, the mattress sits only on metal bars, so it is both a little uncomfortable on the surface, plus it is getting damaged.

product_meta.title: Regalo Swing Down Double Sided Bed Rail Guard, with Reinforced Anchor Safety System
product_meta.description: Our Swing Down Double-Sided Bed Rail design provides the security you need for beds that are not against a wall. Super convenient, the main unit rail swings down and out of the way when not in use. The exclusive Gap Guard feature assures a perfect fit for any size mattress. Sleep tight! In order to adjust the bed rail to fit your specific bed properly, you may need to release the strap locking buckles located on the under side of the plastic hinges. The anchoring straps should not be twisted. If twisted, the anchoring straps may not tighten properly. Rails cover is machine washable. Recommended for 2-5 years old.
feature_bullets: SWING DOWN: The patented swing down feature allows this bedrail to pivot down and out of the way when getting in and out of bed or removing sheets
EASY TO SET UP: No tools required. Lightweight
SECURE: Anchoring strap that secures the bedrail to the bed. Designed with all steel frame
FIT: For use with a twin to queen size bed. ONLY for use with bed and box spring. Sturdy construction, quick installation
DOUBLE SIDED AND EXTRA SAFE: two rails - 43-inches long (hinge point) and 20-inch tall for added security
